h1_38: Medical University of South Carolina Program
h3_39: Medical University of South Carolina College of Medicine
p_64: Dashes ("-") indicate data for a particular field are not provided for this program in Residency Explorer. Reasons why data are not being provided can vary (e.g., they are not reported or available, they are not applicable, or they are based on an insufficient number of people for reporting purposes).
h3_68: # of Filled Resident Positions, by Year*
p_81: *Totals may vary from year to year due to off-cycle residents.
th_99: # of Residents Who Were Graduates of a Joint MD-PhD program
p_102: Our program provides a supportive yet rigorous environment to learn from fellowship trained faculty in a professional and collegial atmosphere. MUSC is a tertiary care center with a Level 1 trauma center, NCI-designated cancer center, the only organ transplant center in SC, and the top ranked Children's Hospital in the state. Residents perform cutting-edge research, teach medical students, participate in QI projects, and have the opportunity to participate in a global health elective.

p_358: The race/ethnicity data are shown alone or in combination with other race/ethnicity responses. Because some individuals may report multiple races/ethnicities, the totals may not equal 100%. Only residents who are U.S. citizens or permanent residents are included in race/ethnicity counts.
